channel.title: BBC News - Science & Environment

item.title: Jeff Bezos and Sir Richard Branson not yet astronauts, US says
item.description: The US government has tightened rules on which space-goers can claim their astronaut wings.

item.title: AI breakthrough could spark medical revolution
item.description: A program has been used to predict the structures of nearly every protein in the human body.

item.title: Road planners able to ignore climate change, campaigners claim
item.description: Government guidelines mean road planners can effectively ignore climate change, campaigners say.

item.title: 'Jurassic Pompeii' yields thousands of 'squiggly wiggly' fossils
item.description: Scientists are excavating one of the most important Jurassic sites ever discovered in the UK.

item.title: Bitcoin climbs as Elon Musk says Tesla 'likely' to accept it again
item.description: The firm had said in May it would no longer accept the cryptocurrency over environmental concerns.

item.title: Russia sends long-delayed module to space station
item.description: The 13m-long, 20-tonne Nauka laboratory is finally going into orbit after a delay of 14 years.

item.title: Jeff Bezos launches to space aboard New Shepard rocket ship
item.description: The world's richest man and three other passengers return safely just over 10 minutes after launch.

item.title: Climate change: US pushes China to make faster carbon cuts
item.description: US climate envoy John Kerry says help from China is needed to avoid a dangerous rise in heat.

item.title: Met Office issues first UK extreme heat warning
item.description: It covers south-west England and large parts of Wales as the UK experiences a prolonged hot spell.

item.title: Ros Atkins onâ€¦ the North America heat waves
item.description: Ros Atkins explains the link between climate change and recent heat waves in the US and Canada.

item.title: National Food Strategy: Tax sugar and salt and prescribe veg, report says
item.description: Boris Johnson says he will consider the proposal, but finds the idea of extra taxes on people unattractive.

item.title: Climate change: Science failed to predict flood and heat intensity
item.description: Scientists want a super-computer powerful enough to accurately project the most damaging extremes.

item.title: Formula 1 boss Ross Brawn says hydrogen could be future fuel
item.description: Hydrogen-powered cars could be the future of Formula 1 according to Ross Brawn, the F1 managing director for motorsports.

item.title: Climate change: Amazon regions emit more carbon than they absorb
item.description: Rising heat and deforestation cause eastern parts of the Amazon to become carbon sources, not sinks.

item.title: Climate change: 'No more excuses' at COP26 climate summit - poor nations
item.description: More than 100 developing countries set out key demands ahead of the climate summit in Glasgow.

item.title: Hubble space telescope's function is restored
item.description: Engineers restore the Hubble Space Telescope to full operations, after a computer glitch in June.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Richard Branson's long, winding path to space
item.description: The BBC tracks the long, winding road to Sir Richard Branson's flight to the edge of space.

item.title: Virgin Galactic: Sir Richard Branson rockets to the edge of space
item.description: The UK businessman realises a lifetime's ambition by riding a rocket plane high into the sky.

item.title: Mystery 19th Century botanist tracked down following appeal
item.description: Pressed flowers and a poem found inside a centuries-old botany book sparked a quest to find the owner.

item.title: Benjamin Jesty: The unsung hero of vaccination
item.description: Edward Jenner is credited with inventing the vaccine but his method was pioneered by a Dorset farmer.

item.title: Climate crisis rallies young people
item.description: Thousands of young people are joining a mission to help solve the environmental crisis facing their generation.

item.title: Covid origins: Scientists weigh up evidence over virus's origins
item.description: Researchers aim to "set the record straight" on how the virus transferred from bats into humans.

item.title: Climate change: How can you make your home eco-friendly?
item.description: There are many ways to reduce a property's environmental impact, says the Energy Saving Trust.

item.title: Astronomy Photographer of the Year 2021: Shortlist revealed
item.description: The competition has received more than 4,500 entries from people in 75 countries.
